00012 #if !defined(RANDOMLIB_EXPONENTIALPROB_HPP)
00013 #define RANDOMLIB_EXPONENTIALPROB_HPP \
00014   "$Id: 5308b59db803f8f5420b27c6c86784070d970571 $"
00015 
00016 #include <vector>
00017 #include <limits>
00018 
00019 namespace RandomLib {
00020   /**
00021    * \brief The exponential probability.
00022    *
00023    * Return true with probability exp(-\e p).  Basic method taken from:\n
00024    * J. von Neumann,\n Various Techniques used in Connection with Random
00025    * Digits,\n J. Res. Nat. Bur. Stand., Appl. Math. Ser. 12, 36-38 (1951),\n
00026    * reprinted in Collected Works, Vol. 5, 768-770 (Pergammon, 1963).\n See
00027    * also the references given for the ExactExponential class.
00028    *
00029    * Here the method is extended to be exact by generating sufficient bits in
00030    * the random numbers in the algorithm to allow the unambiguous comparisons
00031    * to be made.
00032    *
00033    * Here's one way of sampling from a normal distribution with zero mean and
00034    * unit variance in the interval [-1,1] with reasonable accuracy:
00035    * \code
00036    * #include <RandomLib/Random.hpp>
00037    * #include <RandomLib/ExponentialProb.hpp>
00038    *
00039    * double Normal(RandomLib::Random& r) {
00040    *   double x;
00041    *   RandomLib::ExponentialProb e;
00042    *   do
00043    *      x = r.FloatW();
00044    *   while ( !e(r, - 0.5 * x * x) );
00045    *   return x;
00046    * }
00047    * \endcode
00048    *
00049    * This class uses a mutable private vector.  So a single ExponentialProb
00050    * object cannot safely be used by multiple threads.  In a multi-processing
00051    * environment, each thread should use a thread-specific ExponentialProb
00052    * object.
00053    **********************************************************************/
00054   class ExponentialProb {
00055   private:
00056     typedef unsigned word;
00057   public:
00058 
00059     ExponentialProb() : _v(std::vector<word>(alloc_incr)) {}
00060     /**
00061      * Return true with probability exp(-\e p).  Returns false if \e p <= 0.
00062      * For in \e p (0,1], it requires about exp(\e p) random deviates.  For \e
00063      * p large, it requires about exp(1)/(1 - exp(-1)) random deviates.
00064      *
00065      * @tparam RealType the real type of the argument.
00066      * @tparam Random the type of the random generator.
00067      * @param[in,out] r a random generator.
00068      * @param[in] p the probability.
00069      * @return true with probability \e p.
00070      **********************************************************************/
00071     template<typename RealType, class Random>
00072     bool operator()(Random& r, RealType p) const;
00073 
00074   private:
00075     /**
00076      * Return true with probability exp(-\e p) for \e p in [0,1].
00077      **********************************************************************/
00078     template<typename RealType, class Random>
00079     bool ExpFraction(Random& r, RealType p) const;
00080     /**
00081      * Holds as much of intermediate uniform deviates as needed.
00082      **********************************************************************/
00083     mutable std::vector<word> _v;
00084     /**
00085      * Increment on size of _v.
00086      **********************************************************************/
00087     static const unsigned alloc_incr = 16;
00088   };
00089 
00090   template<typename RealType, class Random>
00091   bool ExponentialProb::operator()(Random& r, RealType p) const {
00092     STATIC_ASSERT(!std::numeric_limits<RealType>::is_integer,
00093                   "ExponentialProb(): invalid real type RealType");
00094     return p <= 0 ||            // True if p <=0
00095       // Ensure p - 1 < p.  Also deal with IsNaN(p)
00096       ( p < RealType(1)/std::numeric_limits<RealType>::epsilon() &&
00097         // exp(a+b) = exp(a) * exp(b)
00098         ExpFraction(r, p < RealType(1) ? p : RealType(1)) &&
00099         ( p <= RealType(1) || operator()(r, p - RealType(1)) ) );
00100   }
00101 
00102   template<typename RealType, class Random>
00103   bool ExponentialProb::ExpFraction(Random& r, RealType p) const {
00104     // Base of _v is 2^c.  Adjust so that word(p) doesn't lose precision.
00105     static const int c =        // The Intel compiler needs this to be static??
00106       std::numeric_limits<word>::digits <
00107       std::numeric_limits<RealType>::digits ?
00108       std::numeric_limits<word>::digits :
00109       std::numeric_limits<RealType>::digits;
00110     // m gives number of valid words in _v
00111     unsigned m = 0, l = unsigned(_v.size());
00112     if (p < RealType(1))
00113       while (true) {
00114         if (p <= RealType(0))
00115           return true;
00116         // p in (0, 1)
00117         if (l == m)
00118           _v.resize(l += alloc_incr);
00119         _v[m++] = r.template Integer<word, c>();
00120         p *= std::pow(RealType(2), c); // p in (0, 2^c)
00121         word w = word(p);              // w in [0, 2^c)
00122         if (_v[m - 1] > w)
00123           return true;
00124         else if (_v[m - 1] < w)
00125           break;
00126         else                    // _v[m - 1] == w
00127           p -= RealType(w);     // p in [0, 1)
00128       }
00129     // Here _v < p.  Now loop finding decreasing V.  Exit when first increasing
00130     // one is found.
00131     for (unsigned s = 0; ; s ^= 1) { // Parity of loop count
00132       for (unsigned j = 0; ; ++j) {
00133         if (j == m) {
00134           // Need more bits in the old V
00135           if (l == m)
00136             _v.resize(l += alloc_incr);
00137           _v[m++] = r.template Integer<word, c>();
00138         }
00139         word w = r.template Integer<word, c>();
00140         if (w > _v[j])
00141           return s != 0u;             // New V is bigger, so exit
00142         else if (w < _v[j]) {
00143           _v[j] = w;            // New V is smaller, update _v
00144           m = j + 1;            // adjusting its size
00145           break;                // and generate the next V
00146         }
00147         // Else w == _v[j] and we need to check the next c bits
00148       }
00149     }
00150   }
00151 } // namespace RandomLib
00152 
00153 #endif  // RANDOMLIB_EXPONENTIALPROB_HPP
